Women's Health provides confidential information, examinations, and treatment, and information regarding all women's health issues. Board-certified gynecologists and nurse practitioners certified in women's health staff this unit. Additionally, many of our providers are certified to perform specialized testing if necessary, including colposcopies and biopsies and many are LGBTQ SafeZone trained.     Services available include*:   * Some services may incur a fee.     Complete well women visits including breast exam, gynecological exam, pap smears and other health maintenance testing as needed   Testing and treatment of sexually transmitted infections   Contraceptive counseling, management, and prescriptions (including IUD)   Evaluation of menstrual and other gynecologic disorders     Management and treatment of abnormal pap tests   HIV testing   Immunizations (HPV, Influenza, Tdap)   Pregnancy detection and options counseling     Preconception counseling and testing            Women's Health Workshop   Women's Health offers a general women's health workshop on a variety of topics including:     Contraceptive Options   Gynecological Exams   Sexually Transmitted Infection Prevention   Breast Self-Exam   And more     Workshops are 20 minutes in length and are available throughout the week by appointment. Call Women's Health Services at (212) 443-1166 to sign up. Same-day appointments are available for all women's health issues.                                  Staff Directory                  Learn about our Providers.
